title: How to create a mailing list?
content:
How do I set up a mailing list in this latest version of Thunderbird? In the past I was able to group people in my address book into various groups and then mass mail to a given group (mailing list).

I recently bought a new computer w/ Windows 11, installed Thunderbird just fine; but, I am unable to establish my previous groups/mailing lists.

Does anyone know of a way to doe this? I have looked at the help section on this, but its help advice is dated 2015 and applies to a much older version of Thunderbird. There is no "Address book > new> mailing group" option in this latest version of the program that I can find.
creator: gneiss2

title: Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded
content:
For years I have used Thunderbird. I have had copies of Thunderbird both on my Windows 11 desktop and on my Windows 11 laptop. When I am at home I use the desktop and when I travel I use the laptop. When I leave home I copy the entire Profile directory from Appdata /Roaming directory to the Laptop and then reverse when I return home. Last week I returned home and no matter what I tried I couldn't get the Desktop to use the Profile transferred from the Laptop. It poped up a message that the version was wrong. Upon checking the Thunderbird version on the Laptop I saw it was newer than Desktop. So I uninstalled Thunderbird and reinstalled only to find out that downloaded version was still behind the Laptop. So today I finally was able to install the newest version on the Desktop but now I get the popup titled Profile missing with the following message "Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible."

Any help appreciated getting Thunderbird working on my Desktop.
creator: gbechthold

title: Rollback from 135.0 to 128.7.0
content:
Hi,

I need to roll back from Thunderbird 135.0 (Release Channel) to 128.7.0 (Extended Support Release) without losing any data. However, I am receiving a message about creating a new profile due to compatibility reasons.

I would like to downgrade while maintaining a seamless experience, ideally with just a few clicks. This Thunderbird e-mail client is used in an operational environment. Could you guide me on how to do this?

Alternatively, is there a way to get my add-ons working again on version 135.0?

I also find Thunderbird’s handling of add-ons across different versions quite frustrating. The frequent compatibility issues between versions create unnecessary problems. Is there any plan to make this process more flexible in the future?

Thanks in advance for your help!

title: Broken e-mail presentation after 128.6esr - viewer seems to be ignoring [style="width:100%; max-width: 450px;"]
content:
As per subject, around ~15 of Jan, images in e-mails started to be shown in e-mail viewer with 100% width, redgardles of max-width:$px. Worked as a charm for like 2 years. I have no idea if this is a bug - I didn't see any info in release notes that something was done to viewer and quick jump into bugzilla just gave this topic: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1912242. Changing [style="width:100%; max-width: 450px;"] to [style="width:450px; max-width: 450px;"] seems to work, but thats not the case. When creating new message with exact same html code everything is fine.

PS. I have no idea how to report a bug in bugzilla, heckin' overcomplicated if you ask me, so i decided to start here and if nothing can be done, escalate it there.

title: Problem with sending and receiving e-mails
content:
Hello, We have problem with sending and receiving e-mails. Sometimes Thunderbird just stops receiving e-mails. We can send messages but they can be saved only in local folder. In browser e-mails arrive and we can send them without any problems so it has to be some problem with Thunderbird. We were trying a lot of solutions, but only one works - creating new profile. It is very time-consuming solution, because we have to copy all e-mails, contacts, user settings, etc and we have to create a new profile couple times in a month... We were trying to off our antyvirus, forget password, etc. Probably there is some problem with certificates, but we do not know how to fix it. We use IMAP. Let me know what we can do to solve this problem, because creating new profiles is too tiring... :(

Regards, Maciej Sendziuk

Al mio ok il pop up si chiude ma non ritrovo quel partecipante nella finestra Evento vicino a Descrizione/Allegati/Partecipanti. Anche inviando l'evento quell'unico partecipante non riceve l'invito. Grazie mille a chi mi aiuterà a risolvere questo dilemma che sembra essere solo mio perchè non trovo altre richieste di aiuto sul tema.
creator: francescaguarneri

title: Suggestion: Auto Correct for Message Bodies - more than just correcting typos
content:
This is a suggestion. Please move it to the right place if there is a suggestion box (could not find it).

This suggestion is for something that goes beyond typos. I am aware that Thunderbird only highlights typos.

Auto-correct would be a great addition to the Thunderbird UI. It might be useful in other Mozilla products. Yes, it should fix word typos, ("steve" corrected to "Steve"). MORE GENERALLY than that, it would be very helpful if it corrected a string to a text block.

1. Enter long proper names quickly consistently 

   "usaidd" corrects to "United States Agency for International Development (USAID)"    "nytt" corrects to "New York Times"

2. Enter symbols without knowing the hocus pocus 

   "(c)" to "©"  and em-dash, Registered Mark, ...

3. Add boilerplate quickly and easily 

   "mycpyr" to "Copyright 2025 ©..."

Allow users to maintain the auto-correct list. There are too many trades and professions to manage it centrally. It might be good to pre-populate it with a few common, illustrative entries as examples such as typographic symbols (save user's time) and an copyright template (creative commons?).

Thanks for your consideration.
creator: Steve.Paintr3

title: Setting up BT email account on Thunderbird
content:
I am trying to set up for a friend the Thunderbird email client for his BT internet account but am encountering problems.

When using the BT recommended settings: POP3 settings Incoming Mail Server: mail.btinternet.com Port: 995 SSL Encryption: SSL/TLS Username: email address xxxxxxxx@btinternet.com Password: btinternet password SMTP settings Outgoing Mail Server: mail.btinternet.com Port: 465 SSL Encryption: SSL/TLS Authentication: btinternet password Username: email address xxxxxxxx@btinternet.com Password: your btinternet password

I receive the message “Unable to login in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password.

However if I change the POP connection security to “None”. All is well.

Can somebody please advise.

Thank you.

title: Inboxes not showing messages after POP3 Download
content: I am using Thunderbird version 128.7.0esr on Windows 11 Pro. I moved my Mail folder (and sub-folders) on my local drive. I re-directed each of 4 email accounts to their new sub-folder. The emails are downloading from the email host's POP3 server. New email messages are not visible in any of the inboxes. The counter shows the number increasing when messages are downloading. Global search does not find the new emails. The new emails show when I right click on any of the inboxes and select "Search Messages" (From/Contains."@"). I tried manually removing the Inbox.msf from one account, but did not fix when I restarted. I tried the Repair Folder button (right click Properties on Inbox folder), but did not fix. I know the emails are on my computer, but I cannot get to them without the very cumbersome "search messages" function. Suggestions?
creator: tedJhaney
